#summary Procedure to install simage for Linux

= Simage =

Simage is a multiplatform library capable of loading, manipulating and saving images, creating and saving movies (AVI and mpeg), and loading audio.

= Details =

Download the latest realese of simage, currently _simage-1.6.1_, from the [http://www.coin3d.org/ Coin3D] website by clicking [http://ftp.coin3d.org/coin/src/all/simage-1.6.1.tar.gz here]. Place it into the desktop. 

Open a shell console and navigate to desktop and extract the archive by typing:
{{{
tar -zxvf simage-1.6.1.tar.gz
}}}

This will create a directory called _simage-1.6.1_ in your user directory. Using the shell navigate to just created simage-1.6.1.

Type the following command to build on debug mode:
{{{
./configure --disable-msvc --with-qt=/usr/qt --enable-debug --enable-symbols --enable-qt-debug --with-qt=/usr/qt --with-suffix=d
}}}

To build the library in release mode type:
{{{
./configure --disable-msvc --with-qt=/usr/qt --enable-debug=no
}}}

This will start the configuration process. Depending on your computer, this process may take some time to finish. When it does, install the simage libraries by typing:
{{{
make 
make install
}}}



At the end of the installation process, the libraries hab been installed at /usr/local directory. Now, [InstallingCoin3DForLinux Coin3D] installation can be started.
